More funding for space?   Yes.  More for looking for ET?  Nope.  Just do the science.  If ET is there and wants us to know, they'll let us know.  If they've already been here, they're probably still waiting for us to grow up and behave like adults.

As for the possibility of life on other planets: we know that the count of planets that we can observe with life is greater than zero. Therefore it is logical to assume that the count of planets throughout the entire universe with life is also greater than one.

As for the possibility of intelligent life whose origin is not within this solar system visiting this planet: that probability is exceedingly low. It is not zero but it might as well be. There are too many astronomical impediments for such an event to be likely. Physics, time, distance, resource expenditure are all extremely high when it comes to space travel and their effect is cumulative. Even if you accept that some alien race has gone through all that effort to come here, why would they do that and then play cat and mouse with us?

6) Time travelling humans observing this historical period (World conflict brewing)
7) Extradimensional beings (Angels, Demons, Djinn would have an interest in us)
8) Unknown Terrestrial civilization (Atlantis, Lemuria might have a bone to pick)
9) Extraterrestrials (ET videochat home now, I guess)

I'd put my money on 1-3.
But 6-8 much more likely than 9, if you look at all possibilities.

replies.context: Many of the incidents that have occurred were too long ago to be #1-5.

I am referring to the recent UAP swarms near US naval groups.
But, yes, I agree, some  sightings in earlier decades could not have been 1-5
